#### LIST OF VARIABLES  
              

&nbsp;  
&nbsp;  
  
#### 1. subject  

Volunteer who performed the six activities wearing a smartphone.  

        1 ... 30 .Integer subject  
        
&nbsp;  

#### 2. activities

Activities perform by each subject. See subject variable

        WALKING
        WALKING_UPSTAIRS
        WALKING_DOWNSTAIRS
        SITTING
        STANDING
        LAYING
&nbsp;  

#### 3. signal

33 signal types obtained from the accelerometer and gyroscope. The first letters *t* and *f* indicate time domain and frequency domain from *body* and *Gravity* signals. *Acc* is the acceleration, *Gyro* from the gyroscope and *Jerk* the derivative in time from the acceleration. *Mag* denotes the magnitude of the XYZ vector.  

                tBodyAcc         
                tBodyAcc         
                tBodyAcc         
                tGravityAcc      
                tGravityAcc      
                tGravityAcc      
                tBodyAccJerk     
                tBodyGyro        
                tBodyGyroJerk    
                tBodyAccMag      
                tGravityAccMag   
                tGravityAccMag   
                tGravityAccMag   
                tBodyAccJerkMag  
                tBodyAccJerkMag  
                tBodyAccJerkMag  
                tBodyGyroMag     
                tBodyGyroMag     
                tBodyGyroMag     
                tBodyGyroJerkMag 
                fBodyAcc         
                fBodyAccJerk     
                fBodyAccJerk     
                fBodyAccJerk     
                fBodyGyro        
                fBodyGyro        
                fBodyGyro        
                fBodyAccMag      
                fBodyAccJerkMag  
                fBodyGyroMag     
                fBodyGyroMag     
                fBodyGyroMag     
                fBodyGyroJerkMag 



&nbsp;  

#### 4. coordinate  

X, Y and Z signal directions

        X..Y..Z  .axis coordinates
        "blank"  .no coordinate assigned to that signal
&nbsp;  


#### 5. mean        

normalised mean value by averaging all mean values from different measurements.

        [-1,1] .normalised number

&nbsp;  

#### 6. std  

standard deviation value of all mean values from different measurements.

        [-1,1] .normalised number
